concept.title: Additional Margin Formatting Tips
concept.shortdesc: Typewriters include margin release mechanisms and bell indicators that assist in maintaining line structure and typing awareness.

section.title: Margin Release Function
section.p: The margin release function allows the carriage to move beyond the preset right margin. It temporarily disables the margin stop, enabling continued typing on the same line. This feature appears on both visible and nonvisible margin systems and is often labeled with arrows, “M-R,” or “MAR REL.”

section.title: Bell Indicator
section.p: A small bell mechanism alerts the typist when the carriage is a five character spaces away from the end margin. The sound serves as an auditory cue to prepare for a line break or word hyphenation, helping maintain rhythm and alignment during typing.
